instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message:
2014  MacBook Pro 13 inch need to find out where the jumpers are at on the logic board to see if it will start .
 doesn’t start from the keyboard . 
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> emc 2875
Thanks

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message: These automatically turn on whenever you plug the charger in. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is the signal you short to ground to turn it on, but it will turn itself on when the charger is plugged in.

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message:
Thanks Louis.
Charging is working so I’ll check the pv3 hot?
I’ll check you videos

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message: No Liquid spill that I can see I’ll pull the board.

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message:
You need to measure some power rails to see where the issue is. We have nothing to go on until you do.

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> turns it on, so look for that. But it should auto boot or there is an issue anyway.

Test with a known good charged battery too and make sure you're using a genuine 85w charger.

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message: Thanks I’ll check the power rails

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message:
The power on pads are on the top and bottom of the board at <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5116</RESISTOR> (those components not populated). You should have 3.4ish volts on the <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> line. 
Like previously stated, if you disconnect the battery and plug in an 85 watt charger the board should come on automatically. A 60 watt will not be enough.
I have seen a bad keyboard keep a logic board from booting, so try with and without.

threads.title: 2014 MBP doesn’t start
threads.message: A 60W is fine for 13" machines. Green/orange light present? PPBUS voltage?
